item.title: Shell Basics For Artists
item.description: “Don’t be shell shocked; the terminal ain’t that scary!” A basic understanding of how to get around and find and move files is invaluable to an artist in the VFX/Animation industry (or any industry, if you ask me).
item.dc:creator: Liz Benard

item.title: The History of Linux in VFX and Animation
item.description: Nearly all high-end VFX shops use Linux. Why? In this jaunt down the rabbit hole we explore the history of C.G.I production and how we ended up where we are today. I also talk a little bit about why a studio might specifically choose Linux as a choice for large scale production.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Estrada

item.title: Why use Linux for VFX?
item.description:
When this question is asked, the question between the lines is really “Why don’t they use Windows?” since the only other real contender outside Linux is Apple OSX, which itself is based on BSD Unix. For most intents and purposes, Unix and Linux are pretty interchangeable.
